alert.note: Alert for Goliad; Karnes (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:11PM CDT until May 15 at 11:04PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sandies Creek Near Westhoff affecting DeWitt County. San Antonio River at Hwy 72 nr Runge affecting Karnes and Goliad Counties. Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Antonio River at Hwy 72 nr Runge. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Flooding spreads across the wide flood plain upstream and downstream. No structures are threatened. Livestock and farm equipment will need to removed from the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 32.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CDT Sunday was 35.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 22.5 feet Tuesday morning. It will then rise to 22.8 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will fall to 18.8 feet Thursday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.2 feet on 11/02/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu San Antonio River Hwy 72 nr Runge 27.0 32.2 Sun 9 pm CDT 23.3 21.8 19.4 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
